txt.en:
'Always you press forwards, [placeholder], eager to accept new challenges and face new evils; but there is value in remembering your past deeds. From them, you can learn much!

'Do you remember bringing the broken blade to Narmeleth? Standing before Mordrambor and destroying both him and Narchuil? You stood strong with valour on that day.

'Peer into the Reflecting Pool and experience this memory anew, [placeholder]. You will find that recalling your past may do you much good in the present.'
'I am pleased that you have revisited your experience at the ring-forges of Mirobel, [placeholder]. Only through study of our past deeds can we gain knowledge that will aid us in the future.'
'Have you peered into the Reflecting Pool?'
A Sage of Eriador has invited you to recollect your experience aiding Narmeleth in the destruction of Narchuil and Mordrambor.
Peer into the Reflecting Pool and revisit 'One Hope Remains'

The Reflecting Pool in Rivendell will allow you to revisit 'One Hope Remains.'\n\nA Sage of Eriador has challenged you to revisit your experience aiding Narmeleth in the destruction of Narchuil and Mordrambor.
Talk to the Sage of Eriador

A Sage of Eriador is by the Reflecting Pool in Rivendell.\n\nA Sage of Eriador in Rivendell is waiting to discuss what you have learned from revisiting your experience aiding Narmeleth in the destruction of Narchuil and Mordrambor.
